thread.title: Oklahoma's road back after Texas loss starts at Kansas State
thread.title_full: Oklahoma's road back after Texas loss starts at Kansas State

title: Oklahoma's road back after Texas loss starts at Kansas State
text:
Posted: 4:58 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 Oklahoma's road back after Texas loss starts at Kansas State ﻿ Oklahoma quarterback Baker Mayfield passes in the first half of an NCAA college football game against Texas, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in Dallas. (AP Photo/LM Otero) Sponsored Links NORMAN, Okla. — 
(AP) - Despite Oklahoma fans' shock and disappointment following last Saturday's 24-17 loss to rival Texas, their Sooners are in virtually the same position they were in before the game. 
Oklahoma (4-1, 1-1 Big 12) still has No. 2 Baylor, No. 3 TCU and unbeaten No. 16 Oklahoma State on the schedule - excellent chances to leap right back into the playoff picture. 
The Sooners still have big-time goals, and they are using Ohio State's example from last season as a rallying cry. 
The Buckeyes lost at home to Virginia Tech early and rallied to win the national title.Traditionally, Oklahoma bounces back well. 
The 19th-ranked Sooners haven't lost back-to-back regular-season games since 1999, a span of 34 games. They'll face a Kansas State squad that lost 52-45 to TCU last Saturday. Sign up for our FOX23 News This Morning Newsletter Sign Up
